author: Vikas Pathak
text:
CPI(M) general secretary Sitaram Yechury laying the foundation stone of Harkishan Singh Surjeet Bhawan in New Delhi on Thursday.— PHOTO: PTI

The Communist Party of India(Marxist) will seek cooperation of all “democratic forces to strengthen people’s unity in West Bengal to defeat the Trinamool Congress,” the party’s central committee said on Thursday.

This is being seen as an indication of some kind of understanding with the Congress, though not mean a formal alliance.

The State committee will send its proposals, which will be considered by the politbureau, CPI(M) leaders said.

“We are seeking the cooperation of all democratic forces. If any proposal comes, we will consider it,” general secretary Sitaram Yechury said.

The central committee expressed concern over “the attack launched by the RSS-BJP combine against the Left forces.”

JNU clampdown

It said the clampdown on Jawaharlal Nehru University was part of “a larger design by communal forces to carry forward their agenda in institutions of higher learning,” pointing to the recent incidents at FTII, Hyderabad University, IIT-Madras and Jadavpur University.

To meet Pranab

The Left parties will meet on Friday and plan to take a delegation to President Prsnab Mukherjee.

A senior CPI(M) leader said the government did not seem interested in running Parliament, pointing out that the crackdown on students just before the budget session suggested it was not willing to legislate seriously.
title: Will defeat Trinamool with the help of democratic forces, says CPI(M)
